commitResults.messageTitle: Initial commit to implement Level-0 bot
commitResults.messageBody:
- Removed Duke and created MeeBot
- Implement greet and exit

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 1: Add echo and bye functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added echo functionality to repeat user inputs
- Implemented bye command to gracefully exit
- Enhanced CLI output formatting with right-aligned and word-wrapping
- Established architecture separating UI, Renderer and Messages
- Updated ASCII art logo for MeeBot

commitResults.messageTitle: Code cleanup and CLI improvements - Remove unused Message implementation to clean up codebase - Improve CLI output formatting for better readability and consistency

Level-2: Implement Task and TaskManager with add/list support - Implement Task and TaskManager classes to encapsulate task data and operations - Add AddTaskMessage to confirm task additions - Add TaskListMessage to display numbered task list - Update Main loop and UI to handle 'task' (add) and 'list' commands
Add explanatory comments and documentation to core classes
Level 3: Implement mark/unmark task functionality
commitResults.messageBody: Users can mark tasks as done with command `mark N` and unmark with command `unmark N`.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-4: Implement task inheritance with Todo, Deadline, Event classes
commitResults.messageBody:
- Convert Task to abstract base class with polymorphic storage
- Add type-specific icons and command parsing for todo/deadline/event
- Support deadline (/by) and event (/from) syntax
- Add task count feedback in TaskAddedMessage

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor command handling into CommandProcessor and Command subclasses
commitResults.messageBody:
Extracts parsing and execution logic from main loop into a centralized CommandProcessor.
Each task operation now has its own Command class, handling validation and returning Messages.
This simplifies the main loop and improves separation of concerns between main, UI flow and command logic.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-6: Add delete command functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
Implemented the `delete N` command to allow users to remove tasks, including
comprehensive input validation and error handling for invalid task numbers.
Added the `DeleteTaskCmd` and `TaskDeletedMessage` classes to provide clear
confirmation feedback showing details of the removed task.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(message): rename message classes for clarity
commitResults.messageBody:
Renamed message classes (e.g., AddTaskMessage -> TaskAddedMessage)
to make their purpose clearer and maintain consistent naming conventions.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(error): add centralized handling with MeeBot personality
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce ErrorMessage class to consolidate scattered error strings
into centralized constants. Add validation for invalid formats and
boundary conditions, ensuring more comprehensive error handling.

Enhance error messages with specific guidance while maintaining
MeeBot's Singaporean personality to provide a consistent user
experience.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: Use enum for command types
commitResults.messageBody:
Consolidated command keyword, help text, and factory functions into a
single enum definition to keep all command metadata co-located for better
maintainability. This eliminates switch-case command object creation by
embedding command creation logic directly in CommandType enum.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(command): add help command for MeeBot
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce a HELP command that lists all available commands along
with their usage format. The implementation leverages metadata
defined in CommandType to ensure help text stays consistent with
actual command behaviour.

This improves usability by providing built-in guidance, allowing
users to discover supported actions without needing external
documentation.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: refine Javadocs for Task and Message classes
chore: remove unused imports and methods from refactor
feat(parser): add date/time parsing for deadline tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
- Parse common date formats (d/M/yyyy, d/M/yyyy HHmm) into LocalDate/LocalDateTime
- Display dates in user-friendly format (10 Oct 2010, 10 Oct 2019 10:10 PM)
- Add validation and error handling for invalid date inputs
- Update Task objects to use java.time types for deadline storage

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(parser): add date/time parsing for event tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
- Parse common date formats (d/M/yyyy, d/M/yyyy HHmm) into LocalDate/LocalDateTime
- Display dates in user-friendly format (10 Oct 2010, 10 Oct 2019 10:10 PM)
- Update Task objects to use java.time types for event storage

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(deadline): improve input validation with targetted error handling
commitResults.messageBody:
- Enhance datetime parsing to distinguish between structural and
value validation errors
- Provide context-specific error messages with targeted feedback for
different validation failures DEADLINE_FORMAT, INVALID_DATETIME_VALUE,
and INVALID_DATETIME_FORMAT
- Improve validation logic for /by delimiter split

commitResults.messageTitle: test(deadline): verify UI error messages for distinct validation failures
commitResults.messageBody:
- Test DEADLINE_FORMAT errors (missing /by, empty date fields)
- Test INVALID_DATETIME_VALUE errors (impossible dates like Oct 40, times like 25:00)
- Test INVALID_DATETIME_FORMAT errors (unparseable date strings)
- Ensure each error type shows appropriate user guidance

commitResults.messageTitle: fix(event): improve input validation with targetted error handling
commitResults.messageBody:
- Enhance datetime parsing to distinguish between structural and
value validation errors
- Add validation for end time before start time logical error
- Provide context-specific error messages with targeted feedback for
different validation failures

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor(messages): convert ErrorMessage to record and update error messages
commitResults.messageBody:
- Convert ErrorMessage class to record for immutability and conciseness
- Revise error message wording for clarity and consistency

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: relocate empty list validation logic and simplify message constructors
commitResults.messageBody:
- Move empty list check from ListTaskMessage to ListCmd to uphold
command vs message responsibility boundaries
- Remove unused taskIndex parameter from TaskMarkedMessage and
TaskUnmarkedMessage constructors

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(filter): add multi-criteria task filtering
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add FilterCmd and TaskFilterFactory to handle filter command execution
- Support filtering by task type, completion status, and date with AND logic
- Extend Task class with getDates()method to enable date filtering
- Add filter() method to TaskManager for predicate-based filtering
- Add FilteredListMessage for displaying results
- Update CommandType enum with FILTER
- Include input validation and error handling

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(exception): introduce custom exceptions for filter parsing and invalid task numbers
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, parsing errors in filter commands and invalid task numbers
rely on native exceptions, making message construction inconsistent across commands.

This change introduces InvalidFilterException for filter parser errors
and InvalidTaskIndexException for invalid task indices. The parser and
task manager now throw these custom exceptions, which are caught by the
respective commands to build consistent user-facing messages.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: add TextUi tests for add event, mark/unmark, filter, delete
style(docs,ui): improve Javadocs and format error messages
Merge branch 'add-gradle-support'
feat(storage): implement task saving functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
- Auto create data directory and tasks.json on first run
- Add saveTasks() method to persist TaskManager's tasks to storage
- Implement JSON serialization for task data

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor(exception): unify domain exceptions under MeeBotException hierarchy
commitResults.messageBody:
The codebase previously handled domain-specific errors through multiple
exception types, each requiring separate catch blocks in command classes,
cluttering the command implementations.

This refactoring establishes a unified exception hierarchy under
MeeBotException, where each domain exception implements toErrorMessage()
to generate user-facing error messages. Command classes now use a single
catch block for all domain exceptions, centralizing error message logic
and creating cleaner command implementations without changing the actual
error handling behaviour.

Also renamed package `parser` to `util`.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(command): centralize task input parsing with custom exception handling
commitResults.messageBody:
Task-related commands have common parsing behaviours. Currently, each
command class implements their own parsing and validation logic for
handling user input. This scattered approach creates code duplication,
making the codebase harder to maintain.

The common parsing behaviours are refactored into dedicated utility classes
to eliminate duplication. This approach also makes future modifications
to parsing behaviour easier since changes only need to be made in one location.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: refine Javadocs for Command, Exceptions, TaskManager and Message classes
feat(storage): implement task loading from JSON file
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add loadTasks() method to populate TaskManager from tasks.json
- Implement JSON deserialization via TokenizerUtil and TaskDeserializer
- Handle invalid/missing fields with fault-tolerant reconstruction
- Ensure malformed file format is caught with FileContentException

commitResults.messageTitle: fix(storage): correct serialization of date-only tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, date-only tasks entered were serialized using LocalDateTime,
which defaulted the time to 00:00. When reloaded, these tasks appeared
as if they had an explicit time of 12:00am, which was misleading.

This fix ensures that date-only tasks are saved in plain ISO date format
(yyyy-MM-dd), while tasks with a time are still saved as full ISO date-time.
The change preserves the user’s original intent and avoids displaying imputed
times that were never entered.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(sort): implement task sorting by date and completion status
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added stable sorting methods in TaskManager: sortByDate() and sortByStatus()
- Introduce SortCmd to handle sorting by date and completion status
- Update messages to warn user when sorting may be invalidated after add/mark/unmark
- Support user-friendly error messages for invalid sort input

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: reduce boilerplate in TaskManager and Command classes
style: fix whitespace, newlines and reorder methods for logical grouping
feat(search): implement keyword-based task filtering
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add SearchCmd for filtering tasks by keywords in descriptions
- Support partial, case-insensitive keyword matching
- Implement search() with predicate-based OR logic for multiple keywords
- Add SearchResultMessage with keyword highlighting in results
- Handle empty results with user-friendly error messages

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(parser): Add natural language date parsing functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
The date parser currently relies on strict pattern matching, which
limits usability for common natural expressions that users provide.

Adding support that uses the external Hawking NLP library for parsing
natural expressions such as "tomorrow", "next week", or
"next Monday at 3pm" serves as a fallback when strict parsing fails.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(task): add polymorphic cloning for all task types
commitResults.messageBody:
- Implemented abstract copy() in Task
- Added concrete copy() methods in TodoTask, DeadlineTask, and EventTask
- Ensured cloning duplicates description, completion status, and dates

commitResults.messageTitle: test(task): add JUnit tests for cloning feature
commitResults.messageBody:
- Verified polymorphic cloning behaviour for all task types
- Checked all data fields match between original and clone
- Ensured clone instances are distinct from originals

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(task): add recurrence support and parser
commitResults.messageBody:
- Introduce Recurrence value object that captures how often task repeats
- Extend Task hierarchy constructors to accept Recurrence parameter
- Implement RecurrenceParser for /repeat <type> <count> command parsing
- Handle parsing errors with appropriate exception types

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor(parser): rename util package and reformat Javadoc
feat(storage): add recurrence support to serializer and deserializer
commitResults.messageBody:
The current JSON serialization treats recurrence data as flat fields
alongside other task properties.

Recurring tasks require nested structures to properly represent patterns
and intervals. Flat serialization makes this data difficult to parse and
extend with new recurrence features.

Task serializer and deserializer are updated to handle the nested
structure correctly.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(parser): overhaul JSON parser and tokenizer
commitResults.messageBody:
The current JSON parsing implementation has basic tokenization logic,
and assumes simplified JSON structures (i.e., no nested JSON).

Redesign the tokenizer with lookup tables for optimized token matching
and rewrite the parser with recursive descent parsing for better
structure handling. This provides clearer separation between lexical
analysis and parsing phases.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: extract help text into CommandDocs and move shared classes
commitResults.messageBody:
- Extracted summary/detail help text from CommandType to CommandDocs
- Slimmed CommandType to handle keyword mapping and command factories
- Updated HelpMessage to use CommandDocs
- Created common package for cross-cutting classes
- Moved ErrorMessage and CommandDocs into common

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(help): show contextual help for command without arguments
commitResults.messageBody:
Invoking commands e.g. `event` without arguments results in a generic
error message without guidance on how to proceed.

Let's return contextual help messages instead of generic error messages
when commands are entered without arguments. All commands except
standalone commands (`bye`, `help`, `list`) now respond with usage
instructions and examples. HelpMessage is updated to fetch documentation
from CommandDocs. Javadocs have been updated to reflect these changes.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix(filter): include full date range for event tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
The date filter matches only the start and end dates of an event. If the
filter date falls between these values, the event is excluded.

This leads to unexpected behaviour because users expect multi-day events
to appear when filtering by any date within the event’s duration.

Let's update the filter to treat the start and end values as an inclusive
interval. This ensures multi-day events are matched correctly, while
single-date tasks continue to work as before.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(recurrence): add anchorDate and recurrenceEnd to value object
commitResults.messageBody:
Recurrence type and frequency alone do not provide enough context to
determine when a repeat task begins or ends. This makes it difficult to
correctly match recurring tasks to a given date.

Explicitly storing these fields makes recurrence semantics clear and
allows tasks, storage, and parsers to use consistent boundaries when
handling recurring behaviour.

Let's extend the Recurrence value object with anchorDate and recurrenceEnd.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(filter): show recurring task instances at runtime
commitResults.messageBody:
Filtering only evaluated master tasks stored in TaskList and date filters
would miss valid occurrences unless the master task itself matched exactly.

Update filtering to dynamically create task instances and return concrete
instances at runtime if its recurrence occurs on the filter date.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(storage): extend task persistence to handle recurrence attributes
feat(task): add ReadOnlyTask interface for task immutability
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce `ReadOnlyTask` to separate read-only access from mutation.
Non-mutating operations (filter, sort, list, messages) depend on this
interface,  while `TaskManager` retains mutation control and exposes an
unmodifiable list view.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'add-nlpdates'
refactor(parser): split date-time parser into strategy classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Separate date-time parsing logic into strict and NLP parsing strategies
with DateTimeParser facade for improved maintainability

commitResults.messageTitle: test(task): add unit tests for task cloning, recurrence, task immutability
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add CloneTaskTest to verify copy() preserves description/dates and
resets recurrence
- Add RecurrenceTest and RecurrenceOccurOnTest for recurrence behaviour
and edge cases
- Add UnmodifiableListTest to verify task mutation is possible through
unmodifiable list if the objects within that list are mutable

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor(task): introduce TaskCreator factory for task construction
commitResults.messageBody:
Task creation logic is scattered across multiple classes with duplicated
methods for parsing from CLI args and JSON.

Unify task creation under a TaskCreator abstraction. Define a common
factory interface with methods to build tasks from args and from JSON.
Move task-specific creation logic into concrete implementations
(TodoCreator, DeadlineCreator, EventCreator).

This allows command classes and storage deserialization to rely on a
single, consistent contract for task construction. It reduces duplication
and makes it easier to add new task types by implementing the factory
without touching existing code.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: rename parser.taskops package to parser.commandargs
refactor: unify command execution pipeline in BaseTaskCommand
commitResults.messageBody:
Each task-related command duplicates the same boilerplate: check help
text, guard against empty task list, and catch Exception to return an
ErrorMessage.

Unify the common execution pipeline in BaseTaskCommand so that the
sequence of workflow is handled centrally. Require each subclass only to
declare its command type, implement its specific business logic, and
override whether it requires an empty list guard.

This approach reduces duplication and improves readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: change(exception): make MeeBotException a checked exception
commitResults.messageBody:
MeeBotException extends RuntimeException, allowing it to be thrown
without declaration. This hides the fact that command and parser failures
are expected domain errors rather than programming bugs.

Change it to extend Exception, making it a checked exception. Callers must
now declare or handle MeeBotException explicitly. This enforces clearer
contracts and ensures domain-level failures are consistently handled.

All methods that can throw MeeBotException now require a
`throws MeeBotException` declaration. Call sites must be updated accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix(parser): return empty result set for invalid boolean filter values
commitResults.messageBody:
The "done" filter relies on Boolean.parseBoolean to interpret user input.
Any string other than "true" is coerced to false which leads to
unexpected behaviour such as "done:apple" being treated as "done:false".

This needs to change because it can mislead users into thinking their
filter worked, when in fact the input value was not valid. Users should
not receive results that contradict their intent when they provide an
invalid filter value.

Make the filter return a predicate that matches no tasks if the value is
neither "true" nor "false". This ensures invalid input produces an empty
result set and avoids silent coercion, making filter behaviour predictable.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: add/refine Javadocs for various classes
feat(storage): add error logging for failed task deserialization
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce file-based error logging when tasks fail to load from storage.
Errors are now written to logs/task_load_errors.log with detailed
information including the exception message and raw JSON.

Users can now identify and fix corrupted task data instead of having
failed tasks silently disappear during loading.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(task): add duplicate task detection
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks are treated as duplicates only when every field matches, including
description, type, recurrence, and dates.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: reorganise import statements without changing behaviour
feat(gui): integrate MeeBot backend logic with JavaFX interface
refactor: split MeeBot into App/CLI runner and add load stats
commitResults.messageBody:
Split MeeBot into a slimmer core, an App coordinator, and a CLI
runner. MeeBot now focuses only on command execution, while App
wires storage, task manager, and command processor, and then
delegates control to either CLI or GUI runners.

MeeBot now reports task load results in the welcome message, showing
how many tasks were successfully loaded and how many failed, with a
reference to the error log if applicable. This gives users immediate
feedback about the state of their task list.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix(storage): clear tasks before load to prevent duplicate error
style(ui): update emoji rendering, button icons, and message padding
feat: introduce assertions to enforce invariants
test: add more JUnit tests
chore: file clean-up to remove unused code, rearrange code, optimize imports
docs: add Javadocs for GUI and refine Javadocs for Exception
feat(accessibility): configure GUI buttons for keyboard navigation
commitResults.messageBody:
Enable tab key traversal for all GUI buttons to improve accessibility
for keyboard-only users and assistive technologies. Buttons now receive
proper focus order and visual focus indicators.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: hook “bye” command to handleExit() in GUI
feat: add more assertions
docs: Add Javadocs
refactor: improve code readability and structure
commitResults.messageBody:
- Extracted helper methods to reduce nesting
- Grouped related logic with consistent whitespace and comments
- Moved constants to appropriate scopes (method-level or class-level)

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(task): introduce AddTaskCmd abstract base class for add commands
commitResults.messageBody:
- Extracted common add flow (create → add → message) from Add*Cmd
- Injects a TaskCreator interface for flexible, testable task creation
- Updated AddTodoCmd, AddDeadlineCmd, AddEventCmd to extend AddTaskCmd
- Simplified each concrete Add*Cmd to specify its corresponding TaskCreator

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: improve code quality
feat(gui): add command prompt hints for recognized commands
refactor: AddTaskCmd and tokenizer
refactor: consolidate related packages under parent packages
Configure build.gradle for project JAR
Update README.md
refactor: final sweep before submission
